text: You act like it's you against the world, but it's really you against yourself.
author: Unknown Author

text: Black is beautiful. Black isn't power. Knowledge is power. You can be black as a crow or white as snow but if you don't know and you ain't got no dough, you can't go and that's for sho'.
author: Lewis H. Michaux

text: You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, who had ever been alive.
author: James Baldwin

text: Perhaps home is not a place but simply an irrevocable condition
author: James Baldwin

text: Nothing I accept about myself can be used against me to diminish me
author: Audre Lorde

text: I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?
author: Earnest Hemmingway

text: Well, I like to eat, sleep, drink, and be in love. I like to work, read, learn, and understand life
author: Langston Hughes

text: I am the sea. I am the moon. Let me in.
author: Paul Celan

text: Got a strange way of seeing life, like I'm Stevie Wonder with beads under the do-rag. Intuition is there, even when my vision's impaired.
author: JAY-Z

text: Do whatever brings you to life, then. Follow your own fascinations, obsessions, and compulsions. Trust them. Create whatever causes a revolution in your heart.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
